item.title: Starfield Player Finds Hilariously Weird Loot Stash Inside Some Lockers
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Starfield players are discovering bizarre loot in lockers, adding to the game's detail and exploration theme.
  • A player found baguettes & poutine in lockers, a lifesaver in the game due to starvation settings.
  • Other players found the loot amusing, highlighting unexpected treasures in Starfield.

A Starfield player online has discovered a bizarre stash of loot hidden in some lockers while playing through the Shattered Space DLC. Gamers are still discovering everything that the new Starfield DLC has to offer, but it's hard to find an explanation for this particular find.

One of the main themes of Starfield is discovery. Players have a vast galaxy to explore, all stamped with Bethesda's typical attention to detail that it has become so well known for over the years. Gamers are always finding new things in the game, and the release of the Shattered Space DLC has only added to the number of details to discover. There was even one Starfield player who found a bizarre universe after beating the game 22 times, showing that even veteran players have plenty to find in Bethesda's latest RPG.

Redditor sterrre was in the middle of completing the Legacy of the Fang quest in Starfield: Shattered Space , which takes players through the Tomb of the Fang. While doing their typical Starfield looting, they opened two lockers, only to be met with a huge surprise. One is filled with baguettes, which flow out of the locker, while the other is crammed with CAN-uck! poutine. According to sterrre, they play the game with the starvation settings turned on, meaning this find could quite literally prove to be a lifesaver for this player.

Starfield Strange Locker Loot Stash

There were plenty of other players in the thread who had found this bizarre Starfield loot for themselves earlier in their own playthroughs. Most focused on the fact that they opened one locker before the other, and burst out laughing as they discovered the second. There have been plenty of Starfield players finding loot in unexpected places, but this takes the cake.

With the release of Starfield 's Shattered Space expansion, gamers are curious to see what comes next for the game. Whether it be an expansion or a sequel, it's difficult to imagine that Bethesda will let its sci-fi franchise lie. Just recently, a former Bethesda developer commented on whether they think there'll be a Starfield sequel, and they do believe it will happen. The elephant in the room is The Elder Scrolls 6 and Fallout 5 , both of which are expected to be higher on the studio's priorities at the moment. As a result, it could be many years before a Starfield sequel comes to fruition, unless Bethesda expands or hands out the IP to another studio.

item.title: Silent Hill 2 Remake Guides Hub - Puzzle Solutions, Walkthroughs, & More
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Beginner Tips
    • Getting Started
    • Extras
  • Puzzles and Key Items
  • Trophies and Achievements
  • Bosses
  • Weapons
  • Endings
  • Walkthroughs

Bloober Team and Konami’s Silent Hill 2 Remake is a survival horror game that reimagines the iconic 2001 classic. It follows the story of James Sunderland, a grieving widower who returns to the haunted town of Silent Hill after receiving a letter from his late wife. As James explores the eerie, abandoned town, he encounters disturbing creatures.

The Silent Hill 2 Remake features stunning visuals, updated gameplay mechanics, and mind-bending puzzles that bring James one step closer to finding his missing wife. It’s a must-play for horror enthusiasts and fans of the original game. This guide hub covers everything players need to know to get started with the Silent Hill 2 Remake .

This guide hub for the Silent Hill 2 Remake is a work in progress. We will continue to add more information in the coming days and weeks.

  • Beginner Tips

    While the Silent Hill 2 Remake retains the old story, it introduces new mechanics and puzzles that offer a fresh and challenging experience for both new and returning players. For those who are new to Silent Hill, this section of the guide hub can help you get started with the game.

    • Getting Started

      • How Long To Beat (All Chapters & Locations)
      • How to Save
      • All Difficulty Settings
      • Optimized PC Graphics Settings
      • How to Heal
      • How to Get a Flashlight
      • How To Access Pre-Order Bonus and Deluxe Edition Content

    • Extras

      • Voice Actor Cast List
      • Do You Need to Play Silent Hill 1 Before 2?

  • Puzzles and Key Items

    The Silent Hill 2 Remake is filled with challenging puzzles that require players to think critically and use their observation skills to progress through the story and uncover the dark secrets of the town. While there are hidden clues, some players could use the extra help to solve these puzzles. The following guides focus on different puzzles in the game and provide detailed explanations for solving them.

    • How to Unlock Keypad For Grand Market On Neely Street
    • What Is The Safe Code For Apartment 206
    • How To Complete The Coin Puzzle For Wood Side Apartments
    • How To Solve Room 210's Seesaw Puzzle In Blue Creek Apartments
    • How To Open Room 202's Moth Lock In Blue Creek Apartments
    • Jukebox Puzzle in Neely's Bar
    • Clock Puzzle in Bluecreek Apartments
    • Reception Office Padlock Code In Brookhaven Hospital
    • Nurse Station Keypad Code In Brookhaven Hospital
    • X-Ray Viewer Puzzle In Brookhaven Hospital
    • Director's Office Hand Bracelet Puzzle In Brookhaven Hospital
    • How To Open Safe In Director's Office In Brookhaven Hospital
    • How To Solve Chained Box Puzzle In Brookhaven Hospital
    • How To Open Pharmacy Decorative Box In Brookhaven Hospital
    • How to Turn on the Hospital Generator
    • Gallows Puzzle Answers
    • Toluca Prison’s Weights and Scales Puzzle
    • How to Escape the Bug Room
    • Generator Puzzle Solution
    • Room 202's Mirror Puzzle In Lakeview Hotel
    • Reading Room Bookshelf Puzzle In Lakeview Hotel
    • Reading Room Suitcase Puzzle In Lakeview Hotel
    • How To Open The Gemstone Box In Lakeview Hotel
    • Music Box Puzzle In Lakeview Hotel
    • How To Discover The Secret Of Room 106
    • What Is The Safe Code In Jacks Inn
    • What Is The Safe Code In Jacks Inn
    • How to Open the Garage Door Near Jacks Inn
    • All Keypad, Safe, Padlocks & Locker Codes

  • Trophies and Achievements

    There are lots of trophies that players can unlock by completing specific challenges or objectives in the Silent Hill 2 Remake . The following guides list all the trophies in the game, along with their requirements and tips for unlocking them.

    • All Trophies and Achievements
    • All Glimpses of the Past Locations (Echoes Trophy)
    • Radio Silence Trophy
    • Leftovers Trophy
    • All Memos Locations
    • All Balloons To Shoot In Wood Side Apartments
    • All Strange Photos Locations
    • All Collectables Guide

  • Bosses

    Players will encounter powerful and psychologically disturbing bosses throughout their journey in the Silent Hill 2 Remake. The guides below offer detailed strategies and tips for defeating each boss in the game.

    • All Bosses
    • How to Beat Flesh Lip Boss
    • Pyramid Head Encounter Guide
    • How to Beat Abstract Daddy
    • How to Beat Eddie Dombrowski
    • How to Beat The Final Boss

  • Weapons

    The Silent Hill 2 Remake features a variety of weapons that players can use to defend themselves against the terrifying creatures that inhabit the town. Classic weapons like the steel pipe and handgun return from the original game but with updated combat mechanics. Remember, the right weapon can be a lifesaver in a pinch, so make sure you're armed with the best. Check out these guides to get more weapons in the Silent Hill 2 Remake .

    • All Weapons
    • How to Get the Hunting Rifle
    • How to Get the Shotgun
    • How to Get the Handgun
    • How To Get The Chainsaw

  • Endings

    Like the original game, the Silent Hill 2 remake features multiple endings. There are eight different endings, six of which are carried over from the original game. The two new endings introduced by Bloober Team are significantly more difficult to achieve and involve specific actions taken throughout the game. Below are guides on how to achieve all eight endings in the Silent Hill 2 Remake .

    • How to Get All 8 Endings
    • How to Get 'Leave' Ending
    • How to Get 'In Water' Ending
    • How to Get 'Maria' Ending
    • How to Get 'Dog' Ending
    • How to Get 'Bliss' Ending
    • How to Get 'Stillness' Ending
    • How to Get ‘UFO’ Ending

  • Walkthroughs

    The Silent Hill 2 Remake takes players through eerie locations where the line between reality and nightmare blurs. These locations are crawling with terrifying creatures and have haunting secrets that James must uncover. The following walkthroughs cover every aspect of the Silent Hill 2 Remake , from solving puzzles and finding items to surviving in Silent Hill.

    • Woodside Apartments Walkthrough

item.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard's Biggest Origins Easter Egg Explained
item.description:
Dragon Age: The Veilguard only ports over three choices, all of which are from Dragon Age: Inquisition . While this is understandably disappointing, it doesn't mean that former games and characters aren't shown love; it just means that nothing in the writing serves as a way to undermine a personal player's canon. Another reason is that Northern Thedas is so disconnected from Southern Thedas that some choices wouldn't really show up, but those that do are treated in a way where players can fill in the blanks. For example, Dragon Age: The Veilguard does have a MAJOR Easter egg of sorts for Dragon Age: Origins .

While seeing the Hero of Ferelden in Dragon Age: The Veilguard would have been on a lot of fan's wish lists, this is the next best thing. It pays respects to the Hero of Ferelden and to one of the most memorable moments in the entire franchise. It's been long announced that players would finally, in a way, walk the halls of the fabled Grey Warden fortress of Weisshaupt, and of course, the Warden of all Wardens is going to be honored there.

MAJOR SPOILERS AHEAD

How Dragon Age: The Veilguard References the Hero of Ferelden

Players will battle through Dragon Age: The Veilguard 's Darkspawn as they make their way through the Siege of Weisshaupt, even first encountering an Archdemon. A lot unfolds here, eventually setting the player's eyes on the Dragon Trap. This was constructed to kill an Archdemon ages ago, but on their way there, something may just catch their eye.

Investigating the glint in the central room, just after being given the goal of finding the Dragon Trap, will see players discover a Joining Chalice. As fans know, this is what Grey Wardens drink a mixture of Darkspawn blood, Archdemon blood, and Lyrium from in order to become Grey Wardens. This one, however, is recovered from Ostagar in Ferelden, which fans will also recall as the site where Loghain abandoned the field resulting in King Cailan's death. Just before that, Grey Warden Duncan and Alistair (to a lesser extent) oversaw a Joining ritual in Ostagar where the only survivor would go on to end the Fifth Blight and become known as the Hero of Ferelden. Yes, this is the Joining Chalice players drink from in Dragon Age: Origins .

For some players, this might not be the same thing as seeing the Hero of Ferelden in the flesh, should they still live, but this is a great piece of memorabilia for the Hero of Ferelden, alive or dead. If they are alive, the last time players heard from them would be a letter revealing they are searching for a way to end The Calling. If they are dead, their memory is rightfully honored. This is also not the only way that The Veilguard alludes to the events of Origins , but this Easter egg is no doubt the most endearing.

item.title: How to Play Split-Screen in Black Ops 6
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Split Screen Limitations in Black Ops 6
  • How to Set Up Split Screen on CoD: Black Ops 6

Split screen allows two users of the same console to play Black Ops 6 together. With the option activated, your console screen separates into two halves to accommodate each player.

There’s nothing quite like teaming up with a friend right beside you and sharing the action on the same screen. Luckily, setting up the split screen feature is pretty easy, but there are a few things you should keep in mind. In this guide, we will show you how to play split screen in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6.

Split Screen Limitations in Black Ops 6

There's no doubt that split-screen can make gaming more fun. That being said, the feature does bring some limitations. Let’s take a quick look at them.

Unavailable on PC

Split-screen isn’t available on PC for Black Ops 6 , which can be disappointing for some players. Once you log in, there’s no built-in way to add a second player to the same screen. So, without a way to add more players from the main menu, split-screen play can’t work.

Unavailable on Older Generation Consoles

While it was massive news that Black Ops 6 is playable on older consoles like the Xbox One and PS4, there are some drawbacks. As things stand, split-screen is not available on old-gen consoles like Xbox One or PlayStation 4. In addition, some other features, like the Theater Mode, are missing as well.

You Cannot Play Certain Game Modes

With the split screen feature, BO6 fans can play most game modes, but a few are off-limits. Modes designed for solo play, like Campaign and Free for All, won’t work. Furthermore, there are some areas that you won’t be able to access either, like the Training Ground. Again, this is a feature meant to be used in a solo setting, which is why split-screen isn't available.

How to Set Up Split Screen on CoD: Black Ops 6

Before BO6 players get started, here’s what they need to know:

  • Both players must have their own Activision accounts.
  • You will need an internet connection, since split-screen only works online. It doesn’t support offline gaming.

Follow the steps mentioned below to set up Split Screen in Black Ops 6 :

  • Launch the game on your console.
  • Choose the mode you want to play (Zombies or Multiplayer). Campaign mode doesn’t work for split-screen.
  • Once you’re on the main screen of the mode you have selected, log in the second user on your console.
  • After the second user logs in, players will see the option to add them. Just hit the button.
  • If you see both players in the party, you’re all set.

If you only want to play as a duo, make sure Squad Fill is turned off so that others can’t join.

item.title: New York Times Strands Hints and Answers for November 4, 2024
item.description:
Strands has yet another difficult word-find puzzle for fans of the genre to try. While most word-search puzzles are pretty simple, this one has a unique challenge: You don't know any of the words you are trying to find, or even the theme of those words, before you start.

If the rules of Strands make it sound hard, you haven't seen anything yet; today's puzzle is very difficult, and it contains a bunch of challenging words. If you need help with this one and don't like the in-game hints, you can find some helpful stuff in the guide below.

The NYT Games Strands Puzzle #246 November 4, 2024

The Strands puzzle for today has the clue In a(n)... There are eight things to find: one Spangram category and seven themed words.

New York Times Games Strands Clues

In order to win this one, you will need to figure out the theme and try to dig up the words from inside the letter grid. In the three sections below, you can find some helpful, spoiler-free hints to get you a little closer to the theme for this one.

General Hint 1

General Hint 2

General Hint 3

Spoilers for Two of the Words in Today's Strands

Looking for some spoilers for this puzzle game without having to find a bunch of non-themed words? In each of the sections below there is one spoiler and a screenshot of where that word goes in the grid.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to Today's New York Times Games Strands

The complete answer to this browser game can be found below. Open up the expandable section to see all the themed words and a screenshot of where each of those words goes in the puzzle.

Today's Strands Explained

If you want to see an explanation for this mobile puzzle game, check out what's below. Inside, you will find an explanation of how the theme, the themed words, and the clue word together.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website, available on almost any device with a browser.
